para.emph: Assemble air deflector extensions to the roof air deflector before assembling them to the cab. Install each bolt with its washers and nut so that the bolt heads are visible on the finished side.

step1.para: If you are placing the roof air deflector and panel is not predrilled, prepare the new one as follows:

item.para:
Cut two 1 x 4 1/2 inch (25.4 x 114.3 mm) slots into upper corners using the pattern
.

Align the templates with the rear edge, as shown
, with the template positioned 27-1/2 inches (698.5 mm) from the centerline of roof air deflector. The centerline is indicated by a die mark along the rear edge.
Cut out the slots with a suitable saw, then file and paint the rough edges.

step1.para: Unpack the air deflector extensions and hardware. Paint them per the directions in GROUP 16 - PAINTING in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Install the air deflector bracket seals and the bracket to the cab. Always use new bracket seals. Install the air deflector seal to the cab. Use a new one if the old one is damaged.

Using the extension angles as templates, mark locations of four holes
( Item 3, two per side) for the side extension angles to attach, as shown
. Use an 11/32" diameter drill bit to drill the holes.

Use clamps to temporarily hold the extension angles in place on the roof air deflector, then assemble with four 5/16-18 x 1.0 inch hex head bolts, flat washers and lock bolts. Tighten all fasteners until snug.

caution.para: Do not overtighten fasteners, as this will damage the fiberglass panels.

step1.para:
Remove the rearmost fastener from each roof rear mounting bracket
. Use clamps
to attach the left and right air deflector extensions
to the extension angles (Item 2) and upper deflector mounting channels (Item 5)
.

Using the air deflector extensions as templates, mark locations of three holes for the air deflector extensions to attach, as shown in Figure 10
. Use an 11/32 inch diameter drill bit to drill the holes.
Using the extension angles as templates, mark locations of two holes in each air deflector extension. Use an 11/32 inch diameter drill bit to drill the holes.

Fasten the air deflector extensions to the extension angles and to the roof air deflector with 5/16 - 18 bolts, flat washers, and lock nuts. Use two washers for each bolt. Finger tighten these fasteners at this time.
Use the rear mounting bracket fasteners that were removed in Step 6 to fasten the bottom of each air deflector extension to the roof air deflector. Finger tighten these fasteners at this time.

Fasten the air deflector extensions to the upper deflector mounting channels with 5/16 - 18 bolts, flat washers and lock nuts. Use two washers for each bolt. Finger tighten these fasteners at this times.
Adjust the upper and lower deflector mounting channels inboard or outboard to obtain a vertical rear edge on the side air deflectors.
Tighten all the fasteners from Steps 9 through 11 until snug. Remove all the clamps.

caution.para: Do not overtighten fasteners, as this will damage the fiberglass panels.

step1.para: Slide the trim-flex moldings in place on the molding bracket edge on the air deflector extensions and on the side air deflectors. If lubrication is needed, use a foamy glass cleaner or a similar product.

Locate and mark positions for the self-drilling screws on all four molding brackets: lower position to 8 inches (203.2 mm) from the bottom; upper position 34 inches (863.6 mm) from the bottom. Fasten with self-drilling screws
.
